title: Ticket #6168: Improvements to SELinux configuration
description:
Use Mat Selmeci's comments to improve the SELinux configuration:

I just noticed that for 8.4.11, we set all the daemons to permissive in the post-install script (via semanage permissive -a), but we don't unset it on uninstall (via, e.g. semanage permissive -d). That's kinda naughty... it means that the daemons will still be in permissive mode even after we've fixed the selinux rules in a later version.

It is possible to stick "permissive condor_X_t" lines in the htcondor.te file, which should have the same effect as semanage permissive, but would get removed when the module is unloaded. Perhaps that's what we should be doing?

Also, if we do keep using "semanage permissive -a", then we should stick -N (--noreload) to all but the last invocation, which would speed installation up a bit.
